intro: Geigeria burkei var. intermedia, commonly known as the African violet. It is a flowering plant native to southern Africa, characterized by its compact rosette growth habit and hairy, fleshy leaves. The plant produces showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom from the center of the rosette. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. The species is known for its adaptability to indoor conditions and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth.
